Compiling X10 2.0 for Scalable High Performance

X10 is a new language in the PGAS (Partitioned Global Address Space) family, being as part of the DARPA HPCS program. In this talk, I will present an overview of the X10 2.0 language design and implementation, with an emphasis on how the X10 compiler and runtime system work together to achieve scalable performance.
Greg Steffan
